definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: I love listening to the oldies played on the radio.

sentences.english: You can get all Japanese old mp3 files in following address. Badongo and Rapidshare are the same files.

The song is not just any old song.

sentences.english: I know an old song about love.

sentences.english: Many times she whistled fight along as I thumped my way through the old tune.

sentences.english: Freda : I like old songs, but some of the new songs are good, too.

sentences.english: Let It Be" is one golden oldie from the Beatles."
